data.description: Global PACCAR Electronics is seeking highly motivated students to join our Summer 2026 Internship Program as a Diagnostic Systems Intern. Job Summary As a Diagnostic Systems Intern, you will analyze large data sets from vehicle remote diagnostics to uncover insights that improve product performance, reliability, and customer uptime. You will collaborate with cross‑functional and international teams to develop user-friendly analysis tools and reporting interfaces. Your work will support data‑driven decision-making and enhance the customer experience. We’re looking for interns who are eager to learn, adaptable, technically curious, and comfortable communicating in collaborative, fast‑paced engineering environments. What to Expect Schedule: Full-time (40 hours/week), in person Duration: Minimum 12 weeks Location: Lewisville, TX Start Dates: May 18, 2026, or June 22, 2026 Visa Sponsorship: Not available for this role (H‑1B, TN, OPT, etc.) About PACCAR PACCAR, Inc. is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905 and is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture, and customer support of high-quality light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under its internationally recognized brands Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines and provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business. About Global PACCAR Electronics Global PACCAR Electronics organization, which serves Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF, is a rapidly expanding organization that is transforming the way control systems and software are developed for commercial vehicle applications. This includes developing the latest vehicle controls, display technology, and autonomous truck solutions that exceed customer expectations. You will collaborate with an international, cross-functional team focused on driving superior technical solutions. Successful applicants will demonstrate individual creativity in addressing challenges and opportunities while working within a supportive team to develop industry-leading solutions for the medium- and heavy-duty truck industry. Your next career move is waiting at Paccar to see whether you want to design transportation technology for tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services. Join the PACCAR team today! About Global PACCAR Electronics GPE organization, which serves Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF transforming the way control systems and software are developed for commercial vehicle applications. This includes developing the latest vehicle controls, display technology, and autonomous truck solutions that exceed customer expectations. You will collaborate with an international, cross-functional team focused on driving superior technical solutions. Job Responsibilities Analyze large-scale vehicle diagnostic and telematics data sets. Develop, refine, and recommend improvements to data analysis methodologies Create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings. Present insights and technical recommendations to engineering leadership and cross‑functional teams. Qualifications Third or fourth year of bachelor’s degree completed (graduation date 2026 – 2027) in one of the following STEM disciplines: Data Analytics, Engineering (Mechatronics, Electrical, Software, Computer, Mechanical), Computer Science, or related discipline. Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and engineering judgment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively. Strong initiative, follow‑through, and adaptabilityProficiency with office productivity tools (e.g., Word, Excel, presentations). Ability to learn new technologies quickly and creatively solve technical issues. Commitment to high standards of quality, reliability, and continuous improvement. Desired Attributes Experience with SQL for querying and optimizing databases. Familiarity with Tableau, Power BI, or similar visualization tools. Paccar Benefits The pay range for this position is $25.00 - $30.00/hour (pay varies by undergraduate and graduate degree) SIP 401k with up to a 5% company match Paid Holidays (work-location scheduled) Sick Leave (WA only) Health, Dental, and Vision insurance Flexible Spending Account (FSA) / Health Savings Account (HSA) Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment insurance EAP services include wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling, and more Additional Job Board Information PACCAR promotes equal employment opportunities by implementing policies and practices that ensure employees and applicants are not discriminated against because of their race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status or other legally protected status. This applies to recruitment, selection, placement, promotion, termination, rates of pay, and other conditions of employment.
